Reviews.Title: “Good value in central paris”
Reviews.Author: lindsay_williams
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here over a weekend and found nothing to complain about. This is a fairly basic hotel: the bedrooms are small and the bathroom minuscule but the bed and pillows were comfortable and it had everything we needed. Breakfast was pretty good and the staff were charming, helpful and always went the extra mile. The really good thing about the hotel was it was a great price, about £85 per night for two of us when booked with the Eurostar. Breakfast initially seemed expensive at about £10 per head, but actually compared to anywhere else nearby it was very reasonable. Another key factor is that it was walking distance from Gare de Nord and just round the corner from the Metro, and 2 mins walk from a small supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, customer-service friendly hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Woodzette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a recent business trip and found the experience quite delightful. The best asset of this place is the hotel staff. They are very customer service oriented and were helpful in getting me into my room early after a 10 hour flight, helping with recommendations for superb restaurants in the area, etc. It was also nicely located off of any main street which keep it quiet and relaxing. The rooms were tidy, but I did not find them as clean as I would typically experience. i.e. there were toiletries in the bathroom which were unopened, but the wrapping was water-stained from previous guests. They should have been discarded and new one's put in their place. Also, the floors are wood which usually make for good cleaning, however, there were traces of dirt and dust along the floorboards that was quite noticeable. Overall, I would stay here again, but feel like there are a few tidiness issues to be addressed before being rated a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel...no complaints”
Reviews.Author: sacs_21
Reviews.Content: the hotel is ideally located ..easy walk from the GARA DU NORD...metro is 2 min walk....tourist locations....cafes...bars....easy walking distance...there is an indian restaurant next to it with great food.....rooms...clean ...very efficiently used space....service is good....breakfast is same everyday but i guess its the same everywhere...staff very helpful..know english,french.spanish...would recommend this hotel ....n would stay again...stayed 28 feb 2012 to 2 march 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located between Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est”
Reviews.Author: andye10000
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel (it was a bit expensive, but - hey it's Paris) between the two stations to make it easy for us to come and go. The Panorama was ideal, only about 7 mniutes walk (with our gear) from each station. We arrived about 11am and were only looking to leave our bags so we explore, but our room was ready so we were able to check in. The room was small but comfortable, its a pretty quiet place and we slept well. Located in a nice (not touristy) area of the city with all the amenities: cafes, supermarkets laundrette and metro in easy walking distance. The staff were all very helpful, organising activities and providing good advice. We would efinitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Staff handled major issues poorly”
Reviews.Author: lauren999186338
Reviews.Content: Locked out of our room overnight, multiple faulty fire alarms ... Our issues were flukes, but how a staff handles these types of situations makes A LOT of difference, and in that arena, this hotel totally failed. Not to mention all these issues in a ONE night stay. I’ll start with the good: Our room was spacious, even with an enormous bed The shower was splendid, big enough for two and a “rain” style with water that got wonderfully hot (this is what caused one issue, but we’ll get to that) It was quiet, and tastefully decorated The location is excellent, two minute walk from Metro station with quick access to Gare du Nord Miscellaneous odd bits: I had a real hard time figuring out that the lights would only turn on when the plastic door key was inserted into the switch – since it was pitch black in the room on our arrival, I had no chance at even figuring this out on my own and with no head’s up when we checked in. This same key would also give us trouble later one, but we’ll get to that The bathroom door was a sliding glass door that did not close all the way. When it slid to cover the door opening, it left a really wide (like inch) gap all the way around the sides and top. So the other guest in your room can see, and worse, hear everything. Horrible design. Now for the really bad: #1 During my evening shower the hotel fire alarm went off. Bad enough, having to panic, dry off quickly and figure out what the hell is going on. Then the staff came to our door and said it was OUR bathroom alarm that had triggered the whole building. They asked if we were smoking in our room. We said no, but there was steam from the shower (which should not make a difference but all we could really say about it). They clearly didn’t believe us but at least I didn’t have to go out in the cold with wet hair. #2 After getting home later that same night, our key would not work in our door. Kept showing the red light and on the third push in, it got stuck (with half the key sticking out). My husband went downstairs to get the night staff member, explained the problem, then went to use the lobby bathroom while I waiting on the stairs. Husband returns to find that the staff member has PUSHED THE KEY ALL THE WAY DOWN INTO THE LOCK. Why? WE have no idea. Now what? The guy says they’ll call a lock smith in the morning and put us up in an open room in the meantime. No apologies for the inconvenience (or for making a bad situation worse!), and we spend the night without access to tooth brushes, contact solution, pajamas, face wash, you get the idea… Next morning at 930a I call down to see if they have in fact called the lock smith to get this sorted straight away. He can’t understand me so I go down, and he assures me someone’s been called and at my exasperation when he can’t tell me when he expects the lock smith will show up, starts going on about how they just can’t understand how we (meaning my husband and I) could have broken the lock the way we did. We were infuriated … still no apology and now an accusation?! We left it for the moment as we just wanted the problem fixed and not to make it worse. We finally got access to our room at about 1130a. We get immediately in the shower and guess what … #3 The fire alarm for the building goes off again! My husband gets out of the shower to call down to explain that no, we are not smoking, and then gets back in the shower. Minutes later, a staff member lets themselves into our room to see what the issue is! It’s starting to turn into a joke at this point. #4 After all this, they have the gall to call our room to remind us that check out is noon …. Even though we’d only had access to our room for the last 30 minutes, 10 of which were spent dealing with staff and phone calls about their faulty fire alarm. Wow. So, yes, very one-off issues but handled so very VERY poorly by the staff that it made a bad situation worse. When we checked out and said we expected a refund since we technically did not stay in the room we paid for (not even getting into the fire alarm, the broken door, the accusations), they would not budge, just kept saying they would have to contact the night man first to find out if he indeed was responsible for the key (yeah, that will happen) and only assured us they would not make us PAY for the broken door. Again, just wow. Other than the egregious weird issues, it was a lovely hotel. So, if you like, you can try your luck ... we won't be returning to this hotel. EVER

Reviews.Title: “Decent and reasonably-priced Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonoLion
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eurostars Panorama Hotel for 1 night on a business trip in early Dec 2011. It is conveniently located - as it is a 10 minute walk from the Gare du Nord, and also close to a metro station. The immediate area is Ok and the street is quiet. There are numerous decent-enough restaurants within the vicinity of the hotel. Reception is polite and efficient. I arrived early AM, and left my bag, although they did not have my room ready. The lobby is good and comfortable. I had a very small single room - but it was comfortable. My business colleague had a room twice the size though! The heating in my room did not work at all - which is why I guess they had put a fan-type heater in the room. So, on a cold December night, at least I did not freeze. The room had a small bathroom, but the shower (rain) was excellent. Breakfast was included on a rate of 130 euros - and it was Ok with reasonable continental-type selection. The cooked food at breakfast looked awful though. Coffee was dispensed through a machine. For Paris - which has become ridiculously expensive for even reasonable hotels - this hotel is pretty good and I would stay there again, although not in a room where the heating didnt work and I would try and get a room which wasnt the bog-standard single bed stuff. But hey, I was only there for 1 night, so it didnt really matter that much.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most....”
Reviews.Author: Fieldmouse1
Reviews.Content: The one thing that you will notice about the suburb is that there are quite a few run down alleys and road. This hotel is located in a quiet street,away from the hussle and noise of the main streets which is a bonus,also it is located near a metro station which is of great benefit as you may find out ! The hotel reception is well decorated,and you are met by pleasant members of staff. They are very helpful and nothing is too much bother. The room was again well decorated and the bed was large size ( hard bed). The bathroom had a double shower with loads of piping hot water. There are no tea making facilities in the room as the actual size of the room would make this a problem. There are deals available for this hotel and its well worth the money we paid... A downside to the hotel is the lack of food facilities in the evening,something after a long day you wish were there..

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: kriscasual
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at this hotel. Once we figured out how close it was to a Metro station, we were even more pleased with it! It is a nice location and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The area was safe and near a nice selection of restaurants for the time or two we didn't have the energy to venture far for a late dinner or early breakfast. I stayed with a friend three nights and on my own for two - I was comfortable with the surroundings and didn't feel uneasy traveling to or from the hotel on my own. The room was small as expected, but well kept and clean. The bathroom didn't offer a lot of privacy for the time spent with a friend, but it was sufficient. It's Paris, afterall, who needs a big room?!?! I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: LJAPL
Reviews.Content: Just spent a wonderful 3 nights at this hotel - the room was excellent, spotless, had a big double bed and there was plenty of space including a well equipped bathroom - so good to have a proper hair dryer. The staff were very friendly and helpful and breadfast was good - we got a good deal on bed and breakfast via VIVA but if you can't get a deal plenty of places close to the hotel to choose from too. Overall I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. Easy access to all areas of Paris. One point of advice - if arriving into Paris by train don't walk from Gare du Nord - get the tube to Gare de l'Est and then change to Poissonniere - very easy as the hotel is then just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for Eurostars”
Reviews.Author: slick_uk
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night, would have liked to stay more. I got a bargain last minute deal (E99). Check in was fairly swift with helpful receptionist, electric key didn't work first time but quickly fixed. Room - top notch, v.modern, telly a little slow, but all channels tuned in which made a nice change. Free wifi worked first time and was quick enough. Bed was comfy, bathroom v.modern, and a nice bit of extra space the other side of the bed if you needed to work. One complaint - there were no ironing boards, and I needed to iron my shirt... they did have irons though... all a bit strange, maybe they were all loaned out... Breakfast was pretty good, checkout swift, all good, nice quiet area 10 mins from Gare du Nord with some cafes/pubs nearby.

Reviews.Title: “terrible servive”
Reviews.Author: KrisCobain
Reviews.Content: We chose his hotel based on the good reviews and the good location ( near gare du nord). The hotel is situated in a quiet area with a supermarket and a bakery near by. It is modern, but very cold. Especially the breakfast room is very dark. We had a tiny room in the 6th floor. But the bathroom was the most terrible. There was instead of a normal door a sliding glas door, which was not even properly closing. Yes no privacy. The service was lazy and was unable to give us tips or book us a table in a nice restaurant. They were not even able to speak English with us ( most guests are Spanish) One day was a firealaram a 8 o'clock in the morning and we had to walk downstairs just because someone in the kitchen burned the bread in the oven. We would not recommand this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Value for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: ellynet
Reviews.Content: First things first, I am not used to how TINY the rooms in Paris are, so be prepared... PROS: 1. Friendly concierge - they were all Spanish, I think. Which helps, because I only speak English & Spanish. :) 2. Clean rooms, comfy beds for it being a cheaper hotel 3. Very decently priced 4. Delicious candies at the front desk... really... 5. Good location. We took the train to and from Gare du Nord and walked here with no problem. Also, it's very quiet on this side street. Just a few minutes walking and you'll reach the more active parts of the city. CONS: 1. I could never figure out the shower. Water kept spilling out due to a weird way of closing it. I don't know.. 2. Tiny, tiny, tiny, tiny... but that's a given Overall, I

Reviews.Title: “Well-Priced Choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SMMSBR
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars. Our room was a tiny bit more spacious than the pictures on Tripadvisor suggest. There was no view from the window. The hotel was super clean. The location is not the best, but the better locations in Paris cost a fortune. The metro is very close. Given how expensive cafes in Paris were, I was very happy with the breakfast included in our reasonable room rate. Staff was friendly, but we could not check in a few hours early. Do not use their towels! They are rough like sand paper. The hotel could provide some more toileteries.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, reasonably priced boutique style hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rachxx1xx
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel situated in the 10th arrondissement. Approx 20 mins walk to Moulin Rouge and Sacre Coeur, 2 minutes to Poissoniere Subway station and 10 mins from Gare du Nord so ideal for us as we got train from CDG airport (only about 8 euros each). Modern decor with quirky murals in rooms, flatscreen TV (no English channels but some French and German), and work desk. Tiny bathroom with sliding door but not a problem as we didnt spend much time in the room. Friendly staff who spoke good English, buffet breakfast is good but get there early as the food runs low towards the end of service. We got a good price for the hotel by prepaying online, approx £80 a night inc breakfast which is pretty ok for central Paris. All in all a pleasant stay, would definitely recommend or stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: BartekW
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel with my wife, during our weekend in Paris. I have chosen it for the walking distance to Gare du Nord plus a convenience of a metro station nearby. After exploring the area we have also discovered how close it is to Montmarte from there, also that there is a very fine wine shop almost opposite the hotel. The rooms are very clean and modern, with glass-wall bathroom in the room. Although they are not big, there is enough space. Minibar in the room is not even that expensive, if you compare its prices with the prices of most of Paris' brasseries :) Staying there was a pleasure. Staff was helpful, breakfast was OK and the location excellent. If you are after moderately priced hotel, where you can spend few nights on your break in Paris, this should be your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and well located.”
Reviews.Author: footprints_76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip and it served the purpose well. The room was clean and bright with a nice little balcony, the bathroom was small but fine. It's a 5 minute walk from Gard du Nord. Not a hotel you'd want to spend much time in, but a good place to use as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Stylee hotel close to Gare du Nord”
Reviews.Author: mybloodyvalentine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a walking distance from Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est (a bit further away I guess), very close to subway stop "Poissonnière". The room we stayed in was classy, clean, and quiet. The bathroom was very pleasant and modern; the bed was large and comfortable. The window offered no other view than the neighbors windows, but the advantage was that the room was very quiet. The staff was just ok at night, but friendly and helpful in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad that we booked this”
Reviews.Author: Hepu
Reviews.Content: Found a good deal in Hotels.com and stayed here for a long weekend. Location: Near Gare du Nord station and Metro Poissonniere. We took RER B train from CDG airport to Gare du Nord and walked ~10mins to the hotel. The street itself is very quiet. Near the hotel there are supermarkets and a bakery. We like to walk a lot when sightseeing but still used metro (cheap) usually once or twice a day to save time and feet. Room: Very spacious and clean with wooden floor. Double bed was really big. Somebody had commented here that beds are hard. I slept extremely well and didn't feel it too hard but understand if someone might. Bathroom was separated with sliding glass door and didn't feel it uncomfortable as staying with my spouse. Bathroom felt a bit chilly in the mornings as there was no heating. It's true that there was no shampoo/conditioner but just shower gel and soap but didn't ask if those would have been available from the reception. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but we didn't need those. Breakfast: Breakfast was a buffet style breakfast with the basic stuff: breads, croissants, bacon, sausages, yoghurt, fruits, cereals, juice, coffee/tea. For price 9,50eur ("october promo price") it was worth eating it. Wlan: There was a free wlan available in the room. On Saturday evening it was stuck/slow but on Sunday morning it was really fast. So I imagine it might depend from how many people are using it at the same time. Service: I felt that the service was ok. They spoke English and we were served appropriately.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, very quiet street in the evening”
Reviews.Author: BambangKaro
Reviews.Content: Very nice and stylish and clean hotel. Location is not easy to find if choosing not to take metro. If taking 'Poissonere' Metro, the street is just next to one of its exits.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: gypsycat13
Reviews.Content: Are you looking for a hotel where the edging readily falls off the door to the en suite, the curtains detach from their runners if you open the window, the TV entertainment consists of a few measly channels in French only, the already limited buffet breakfast readily runs out of basics such as eggs and your room maid is a surly woman who takes pride in closing lift doors in your face? If so, this is the hotel for you. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room.The breakfast is expensive and not worth the money. The best points of the room were a good hairdryer and magnifying mirror, but there was no shampoo and conditioner, no shower cap and no moisturiser.You get these in even the most basic b and b! The maid did not replace used glasses with clean ones and did not clean the bathroom properly. Vous desirez tea and coffee making facilities in your room? – mais non, vous must be joking. Bedroom walls patched up in a different shade of paint to the rest of the room? – mais oui. There is a plus point in the location, walking distance to Eurostar and the Metro on the corner, but I would not recommend this place to anyone and for what it is, it is very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, close to restaurants and transport.”
Reviews.Author: TravelClaim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on purpose for visiting Paris during the evening and some day excursions. The area was quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of the main roads and was seemingly safe. The surrounding buildings were apartments and businesses. Pros: Room was quite spacious, comfortable and elegant. Close to cafes, shops, metro, buses and taxis (albeit hard to get a taxi!). Nicely stocked mini-bar. Cons: Air conditioner did not work, I spoke to the staff and they said "it should be working", but they put me in another room...same problem. The Air con will turn on but no cold air or any air can be felt coming out of the vent. At night I opened the window which was fine but if a loud car went past the sound reverberated off all the buildings waking me up...which was bad in the morning! If this was summer I would of found another hotel. I did note this to the staff after I checked out. Also when I requested a taxi, the guy simply told me he has tried to get taxis for other people and they were fully booked. So i lugged my three bags of luggage through the Metro. But that was only from that staff member who was lazy. Internet also seemed to have a firewall blocking even the most basic sites, I couldnt access a particular news site to get local news from Australia or check in on my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: tedtrotter
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - really glad I booked this one. We chose this hotel because we'd stayed in a Eurostars in Luca in Italy and loved it there. We were having a long weekend (Fri - Mon) in Paris and wanted somewhere handy for getting to and from CDG airport and for town and this hotel hit the spot. We were given a choice of rooms on arrival, either one with a large double or two single beds together, with more space. We chose the later and were delighted with our room. Very clean and bright and a view of the Eiffel Tower on the wall! Handy for Gare du Nord which linked from CDG airport... if the trains were running, which they weren't but we got the bus which took longer but got us close to Gare Nord and it was an easy walk to the hotel. Loads of local places to eat, very close to Metro but we also found it close enough to walk into and out of town. AC was great and Wifi worked and was free, which is exceptional in my experience of French hotels. Great room, great bed and staff were very helpful and nice. We didn't eat in the hotel as we were on room only basis. Room was large and clean, bathroom was clean and shower was lovely. There was a safe in the room for passports and iPad etc. Our room backed on to a small courtyard and was completely quiet. As a smoker, it was nice to have a courtyard to stand and smoke in, rather than feeling like a hooker on the street!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: kulLondon
Reviews.Content: We arrived off the Eurostar and walked from the station to the hotel, approx 10 minutes walk. The hotel in located in a very quite street a little tucked away. We were able to check into our room straight away which was great. Staff were very friendly and spoke good english which is always a bonus when you dont speak no french. The rooms were clean, modern and airy. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel as there are plenty of little cafes and supermarkets close by. The only disappointment was no tea making facilities in the room. The hotel is in easy walking distance to the gare du nord and gare de l'est. Also very close to poissonniere metro station. We even walked into the centre of paris which is easy enough if you like walking. Overall a pleasant stay but a little expensive for the actually time spent in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Eurostars Panorama okay for wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: rugbytommo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there because of proximity to Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est but It is not so close that you cannot get lost. Okay for walking into the city as well. Fine for the wheelchair - plenty of room. Breakfast not free ( normally ) and no kettle or anything to make a cup of tea in room. Quite expensive but that is Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Would have rated this hotel 5 Stars, but...”
Reviews.Author: TourEiffelTrois
Reviews.Content: There was no heat in either of our rooms for two nights! Repeated requests to have it fixed were ignored by one clerk and manager after another. We were offered blankets. I don't care how cute and reasonable is a hotel, you really need heat in a Paris winter! They didn't respond to my email following the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area, nice rooms and worth checking out”
Reviews.Author: Galtegrens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days. I had spend a lot of time trying to find a suitable hotel for our trip to Paris. The earlier reviews definitely helped, and made me make up my mind to try it out. Positive: This is a good base in Paris, in a very quiet area Good breakfast, more alternatives than expected The hotel is newly renovated and has nice rooms Good housekeeping Free use of computer in the lobby - including printing (remember to book time in advance on this website (http://www.tour-eiffel.fr/teiffel/uk/) if you want to visit the Eiffel Tower - very effective! Short distance (3 minutes) to the nearest metro station (Poissoniere) "Negative": If you stay in the rooms facing inwards you can be bothered with people smoking outside in the court - so keep your windows closed The beds are incredibly hard - had to use 4 douvees to compensate

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerchicag0
Reviews.Content: They are Thieves!!!! Both my Ipod and Cell Phone went missing at this hotel! Shady dealing all around and not to be trusted, you should feel secure about leaving your belongings with any decent hotel. Do not stay here! Shame on these people!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, a top hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ingenious
Reviews.Content: Located in the 10th Arr close to Montmatre and the Gard Du Nord its an excellent base for exploring the city. After arriving 6 hours late due to snow and the Eurostar we headed straight for the hotel, and after a few wrong turns we arrived and were pleasantly surprised by such a modern interior. The male receptionist was friendly, polite and offered us a wonderful room. The room itself was huge, the bed would have easily fit four people and the shower room was spotless. As others have said there is a slight issue with the sliding doors not reaching the other side, but it seems it could easily be rendered by the hotel with a screwdriver. If you're comfortable with your partner its not an issue, but if with a work colleague probably best to get separate rooms. The shower had a superb rainforest head perfect for heating up from the cold outside. A 30 second walk from the hotel a supermarket, pasta shop, bakery and the metro station can be found. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and clean boutique hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: acetaminophen
Reviews.Content: I am surprised this hotel is not ranked higher! I stayed in this hotel in late June 2008. I think at that point it had been renovated for not too long. When booking the room online I remember seeing a mix of new and old pictures of a dated and gaudy looking hotel claiming to be this hotel (it had the same address). Well rest assured, Hotel Eurostars Panorama has been complete renovated and it is extremely modern and classy looking now. My partner and I were very pleased with the room. It was a little small, but suitable for a few nights stay. The room was very clean with a huge and comfy bed taking up most of the space. There is a work table with a lamp that didn't get used much though during our trip and also a little storage area for hanging up coats, suits, etc. Our room faced the inside of the hotel which didn't lend a great view, but it was quiet. You could even see into some of the rooms because they are situated so close. The bathroom was small but clean. The sink did have some stains in it, which was odd considering it was relatively new then. If you are not going with your partner, then privacy could be an issue as the bathroom is separated from the rest of the room only by a sliding door and is not by any means sound proof! Otherwise, it is fine. The power shower and rainshower was probably the highlight of the whole room for me. I absolutely loved the rainshower and could be in there all day! There were some basic toiletries and a hair dryer provided and also plenty of towels. Location-wise, the hotel is on a quiet side street, close to Poissonnière and walking distance to Gare du Nord, making it very convenient to catch the Eurostar, which is how we arrived. There is a supermarket nearby too so you can stock up on snacks and drinks. We didn't really need to ask the staff for anything, but they were all friendly from what I recall. We didn't have the breakfast because it was very pricey and from what I read it's not that great. Contrary to what it says on their website, our room did not have a bathtub, just a shower stall. There were also no coffee/tea making facilities, which they don't provide, but we would have liked. There were some teething problems during our stay like wifi internet not working as promised and it took awhile to get our room ready/confirmed. We were also given keycards to our room that did not work. But the front desk helped us sort those out when we went back to them. A cleaning lady knocked on our door once too before we were due to check out. Slight inconveniences, but overall very enjoyable stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for an affordable, clean, stylish, comfortable hotel in an excellent central location with great transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Large comfy rooms, excellent staff, modern refurb, awesome shower”
Reviews.Author: Camnicsydney
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here early september and absolutely loved this hotel. A very last minute decision we booked online the morning of our arrival. The front desk receptionist, Susannah is worth her weight in gold. She was super friendly, helpful and efficient. We had a room on the 1st floor at the back of the hotel and even though it didnt have a view it was exceptionally quiet. The room was huge in paris terms. The bed was a total dream....the shower had a 'rain shower' with excellent water pressure and it was so spacious. The floors were made of floor boards which had a nice clean, hygienic feel to them, great wireless internet and overall just perfect. We paid 123 euro/nt direct through their website and even though it was slightly more than we intended to pay we were overwhelmed with our overall stay. We didnt get breakfast included but the location was excellent. there was a supermarket less than 50 mtrs away, metro was 2 blocks and not to mention a fantastic choice of bakeries, patisseries and cafes to try. Loved this hotel and will happily sing its praises to anyone we know going to paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but no privacy in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Alastair3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times now due to it's excellent location and cleanliness, but the bathroom doors have a big gap between the door and the wall meaning that the other person in the room can see you using the toilet or shower!! Very disconcerting!! I thought they would have fixed this by now, but one year after the renovation they have still not fixed the problem

Reviews.Title: “OK...ish...but don't book breakfast or expect WiFi to work.....”
Reviews.Author: tiredandweary
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday, checked in without any problems, though we did say that we would like to cancel our booking for breakfast if possible (as we had read some 'iffy' reviews about it) but it wasn't. This wasn't too much bother so we decided to stick with it. Location of hotel was excellent, very near to both the Gare du Nord and a Metro Line (Pink No 7). Room was on 6th floor and quite small but spotlessley clean (as were communal areas). Bathroom was a little wierd - a glass box type affair in the corner of the room (taking up quite a lot of the tiny floorspace!!) Glass totally opaque but still felt a little bit 'public'. Also, the sliding door didn't shut properley, leaving a 3 or 4 inch gap giving your comapnion a full-on view into the loo! This is ok if you're very close with the person you're travelling with - if you're a little more shy, it might bother you a lot!! TV looked nice, just didn't work properley at all. There was meant to be a selection of channels, but it was very limited and the reception was awful - a good picture required one person to stand by the window and if they moved, then the picture fuzzed and turned black and white - frustrating!! Also, no WiFi access at all over the three nights we were there, and no internet access either on the computer in the reception area. These things were all little problems as we weren't in the hotel a lot, but the breakfasts were a totally different matter....... On the first morning we arrived for breakfast and it still wasn't all laid out, despite it being 20 minutes after 'opening' time. The coffee came from a machine and was awful. On the second morning the coffee machine was broken and there was a nice jellified lump of cold eggs and some chopped up frankfurters left in the hot breakfast section - yum. I asked for coffee from the kitchen, was told to go away and wait. 10 minutes later, a tiny pot arrived. On the third morning there was no coffee at all (!!!!) and only tea on offer. Again, no bacon, just a cold lump of rubbery egg and no frankfurter this time either. Along with the lack of coffee, this broke my patience, so on check out later that morning, I complained about the (expensive) but awful breakfasts and was told that I could have a 4 Euro discoount on that morning's breakfast and no more! Not wonderful then on the customer service side of things......... All in all, this hotel was OK(ish), but please don't take the breakfasts!

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Panorama Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 9, rue des Messageries, 75010 Paris, France
